unnormalised: The day my Class 10th results were announced, I remember being glued to the computer screen. My roll no. seemed to blur as my heart pounded. When the marks finally appeared – 92% – a wave of relief washed over me, followed by pure elation. My parents, especially Papa, were beaming. He kept saying "Well done, beta!" and immediately started planning a celebratory dinner. That marksheet felt like a golden ticket.
normalised: The day my Class tenth results were announced, I remember being glued to the computer screen. My roll number seemed to blur as my heart pounded. When the marks finally appeared – ninety two percent – a wave of relief washed over me, followed by pure elation. My parents, especially Papa, were beaming. He kept saying "Well done, beta!" and immediately started planning a celebratory dinner. That marksheet felt like a golden ticket.

unnormalised: Next came the hurdle of Class 12th. I opted for the science stream, driven by dreams of becoming an engineer. The pressure was immense, with coaching classes, tuitions, and endless hours of studying. There were days I wanted to give up, especially after scoring just 65% in a particularly tough mock test. But I persevered, fueled by chai and the unwavering support of my family and friends.
normalised: Next came the hurdle of Class twelfth. I opted for the science stream, driven by dreams of becoming an engineer. The pressure was immense, with coaching classes, tuitions, and endless hours of studying. There were days I wanted to give up, especially after scoring just sixty five percent in a particularly tough mock test. But I persevered, fueled by chai and the unwavering support of my family and friends.

unnormalised: Finally, the JEE results were out. My rank, 1234, wasn't quite what I’d hoped for, but it was enough to get me into a decent engineering college. I remember seeing "Congrats! Qualified" on the screen, and the sheer relief of making it. I ended up studying at a state engineering college instead of an IIT, but I threw myself into my studies. I remember aiming for that perfect CGPA and trying my best.
normalised: Finally, the J-E-E results were out. My rank, one thousand two hundred and thirty four, wasn't quite what I'd hoped for, but it was enough to get me into a decent engineering college. I remember seeing "Congrats! Qualified" on the screen, and the sheer relief of making it. I ended up studying at a state engineering college instead of an I-I-T, but I threw myself into my studies. I remember aiming for that perfect C-G-P-A and trying my best.

unnormalised: Four years flew by in a blur of coding, assignments, and late-night study sessions. Earning my B.Tech degree felt like the culmination of years of hard work. Looking back, I am proud of scoring 8.7 CGPA. Receiving my degree certificate from the hands of the VC during the convocation was a moment I'll cherish forever. It's a memory etched in my mind.
normalised: Four years flew by in a blur of coding, assignments, and late-night study sessions. Earning my B dot Tech degree felt like the culmination of years of hard work. Looking back, I am proud of scoring eight point seven C-G-P-A. Receiving my degree certificate from the hands of the V-C during the convocation was a moment I'll cherish forever. It's a memory etched in my mind.

unnormalised: Now, years later, those certificates – from Class 10th to my B.Tech – are framed and hanging on my wall. They're more than just pieces of paper; they represent years of dedication, perseverance, and the unwavering belief in myself. They serve as a constant reminder that with hard work and determination, anything is possible, and are an excellent conversation starter when visitors come over.
normalised: Now, years later, those certificates – from Class tenth to my B dot Tech – are framed and hanging on my wall. They're more than just pieces of paper; they represent years of dedication, perseverance, and the unwavering belief in myself. They serve as a constant reminder that with hard work and determination, anything is possible, and are an excellent conversation starter when visitors come over.
